sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the symmetric difference of A and B, then find the Cartesian product of the result with set C = {5, 6}. Next, find the symmetric difference of B and C, and then find the Cartesian product of the result with set A. Finally, find the symmetric difference of the two Cartesian products obtained and show that it is not equal to the symmetric difference of A and B.
